attributes.name: AddressCardComponent
attributes.description:
Component that renders the address information in a card component.

<Address::Card
 @label="Delivery address"
 @recipient="John doe"
 @address="Fake street 123"
 @city="NYC"
 @country="USA"
/>

attributes.name: ChangesetFormComponent
attributes.description:
Component that yields a Changeset instance of the underlying model that would be passed as a model argument to BS Form component.

It looks up any validations for the changeset defined by the validators parameter.

Simple usage of this component may look like this:

 <ChangesetForm
   @model={{this.model}}
   @onSubmit={{fn this.save}}
as |changeset form|>
  <form.element
    @name="username"
    @label="Enter username"
  />
</ChangesetForm>

accessors.name: validations
accessors.description:
Property getter that extracts the Changeset validations object from the Ember Containers if the validators argument is specified.

 <ChangesetForm
   @model={{this.model}}
   @validations="account"
   @onSubmit={{fn this.save}}
>
   ...
</ChangesetForm>

attributes.name: IconEbfComponent
attributes.description:
EBF Icon component that renders the icon from the EBF iconset.

<Icon::Ebf @icon="ebf-user" />

attributes.name: InputsCounterComponent
attributes.description:
Component that is used to render a Bootstrap Input group component with a number input field, increment and decrement buttons.

<Inputs::Counter
 @label="Size"
 @placeholder="Enter your size"
 @min="10"
 @max="20"
 @value={{this.value}}
 @onChange={{fn (mut this.value)}}
/>

accessors.name: min
accessors.description: Minimum allowed value, defaults to 0

accessors.name: max
accessors.description: Maximum allowed value, defaults to Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER

accessors.name: value
accessors.description: Input value, defaults to minimum value

attributes.name: LanguageSwitcherComponent
attributes.description:
Component that renders the Language switcher as a Bootstrap Dropdown component.

It uses the locale service under the hood to extract the list of available locales, the currently active locale and to update it.

The component has a single boolean argument showFlags to display flags before language label. Omitting this argument will hide the flags.

<LanguageSwitcher />

attributes.name: LayoutHeadlineComponent
attributes.description: Component that uses Embers in-element helper that renders the contents inside the page-headline element in the application layout.

accessors.name: destinationElement
accessors.description: Destination HTML element where the component body would be rendered.

attributes.name: LayoutWizardComponent
attributes.description: Component that uses Embers in-element helper that renders the contents inside the page-wizard element in the application layout.

accessors.name: destinationElement
accessors.description: Destination HTML element where the component body would be rendered.

attributes.name: PagerComponent
attributes.description: Component that renders Bootstrap pagination

accessors.name: currentSize
accessors.description: Property that defines the current page size

accessors.name: currentPage
accessors.description: Property that defines the current page

accessors.name: totalPages
accessors.description: Property that returns a total number of pages

accessors.name: totalResults
accessors.description: Property that returns a total number of results

accessors.name: hasNext
accessors.description: Checks if there is a next page

accessors.name: hasPrevious
accessors.description: Checks if there is a previous page

accessors.name: previousPage
accessors.description: Previous page number

accessors.name: nextPage
accessors.description: Next page number

accessors.name: pages
accessors.description: Generates an array containing the page links range

attributes.name: ProgressBarComponent
attributes.description: Component that renders the progress items.

attributes.name: TableComponent
attributes.description: Component used to render the Ember easy-table component

accessors.name: sort
accessors.description: Parses the sort query parameter that comes from the controller into a Sort instance that contains the name of the column and the current sort direction.

variables.name: CONTENT_TYPES
variables.description:
HTTP Content Types

import { CONTENT_TYPES } from 'ember-cli-commons/constants';

CONTENT_TYPES.JSON === 'application/json; charset=utf-8';
CONTENT_TYPES.URL === 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded';

variables.name: AVAILABLE_CONTRIES
variables.description: List of available country codes for selection

attributes.name: CountryLabelHelper
attributes.description: Helper used to display the translated country name from a country code

attributes.name: DestroyHelper
attributes.description:
The {{destroy}} helper provides a quick way to destroy models using the DestroyerService from your templates.

<button type="link" onclick={{destroy model}}>Delete</button>

fields.name: destroyer
fields.description: Injected Destroyer service instance

functions.name: disableBubbling
functions.description:
Helper that is used to stop event propagation.

You can use this helper on Ember on helper action callback:

<a href {{on "click" (disable-bubling this.action)}}>
 Some link
</a>

Or directly on an HTML element as an event listener:

<button type="button" onclick={{fn (disable-bubling this.action)}}>
 Button
</button>

attributes.name: ErrorHandlerHelper
attributes.description:
Helper class that handles error using the ErrorResolver service and shows the error message using the Notify service from the ember-notify addon.

<SomeComponent @onError={{error-handler}} />

fields.name: resolver
fields.description: Injected error resolver instance

attributes.name: HasPermissionHelper
attributes.description:
Helper class that checks if the currently logged in user, which is extracted from the sesson service, contains a list of given permissions.

{{#if (has-permission "important-permission")}}
   <p>Something important</p>
{{/if}}

fields.name: session
fields.description: Injected Session service instance

attributes.name: PersistHelper
attributes.description:
The {{persist}} helper provides a quick and easy way to persist models using the PersisterService from your templates.

<button type="submit" onclick={{persist model}}>Save</button>

fields.name: persister
fields.description: Injected Persister service instance

attributes.name: RequestInterceptor
attributes.description: Request interceptor that is used by the AJAX service to customize the Fetch requests and responses.

fields.name: after
fields.description: Similar to Ember Initializiers you can also sort request interceptors. This property defines after which interceptors should this interceptor be ran.

fields.name: before
fields.description: Similar to Ember Initializiers you can also sort request interceptors. This property defines before which interceptors should this interceptor be ran.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the Request interceptor. If this property is null or empty the name of the file is used. It is important that the name of the interceptor is unique across the application.

methods.name: request
methods.description: Hook used before the Request is executed by the AJAX service.

params.name: request
params.description: Fetch Request object

methods.name: response
methods.description: Hook used after the Request is executed and the Response is obtained.

params.name: request
params.description: Fetch Request object

params.name: response
params.description: Fetch Response object

attributes.name: Locale
attributes.description:
Locale type that contains the language and country code information.

const locale = Locale.from('en-us');
locale.language // prints en
locale.country // prints US
locale.iso // prints en_US
locale.locale // prints en-US

fields.name: language
fields.description: Locale's language code, eg: en

fields.name: country
fields.description: Locale's country code, eg: US

methods.name: from
methods.description:
Creates a new Locale instance out of a given ISO locale string.

Locale.from('de-de); // Locale { country: 'DE' language: 'de' }
Locale.from('en_GB); // Locale { country: 'GB' language: 'en' }

params.name: locale
params.description: locale

methods.name: is
methods.description: Checks if this instance is the same as the given Locale or locale string.

params.name: locale
params.description: locale to check

accessors.name: iso
accessors.description: ISO locale string, eq: en_US

accessors.name: locale
accessors.description: Javascript locale string, eq: en-US

attributes.name: RequestError
attributes.description:
Custom Error type that is thrown when an AJAX request fails with a non-ok status code.

This class contains the Response object that can be used to extract the error payload in order to show more details about the error in the UI.

attributes.name: ResolvedError
attributes.description: Class return by the ErrorResolver once the error is properly resolved.

fields.name: errors
fields.description: Array of translated objects with title and detail HTML safe strings

fields.name: status
fields.description: HTTP Status code that is resolved from the original cause

fields.name: cause
fields.description: Cause of the error that led to the resolved error

attributes.name: AjaxService
attributes.description:
Service that is used to execute AJAX requests accross the application.

export default class MyController extends Controller {
   @service() ajax;

   @task() fetch * () {
     return yield this.ajax.json('/api/endpoint'); // uses the default host
   }

   @task() external * () {
     return yield this.ajax.json('https://external.com/api/endpoint'); // uses defined host
   }
}

fields.name: locale
fields.description: Locale service instance used to apply the currently active Locale to the request.

fields.name: cookies
fields.description: Cookes service instance used to perform Cookie sync after each completed request.

fields.name: progress
fields.description: Progress service instance used to manage the NProgress loading indicator

methods.name: json
methods.description:
Executes an AJAX request using Fetch polyfill and returns a JSON Object from the response.

It could throw a RequestError in case the server responds with a non-ok status code or if the response data could not be parsed into a JSON object.

Usage:

try {
   const users = await this.ajax.json('/api/users');
} catch (e) {
   console.error('Failed to fetch users from the API', e);
}

params.name: url
params.description: Request path or an absolute URL

params.name: options
params.description: Request options

params.name: options.progress
params.description: Should the service increment or decrement progress counter, defaults to `true`

params.name: options.contentType
params.description: Defines a content type header for the request, defaults to `application/json`

params.name: options.cache
params.description: Contains the cache mode of the request (e.g., `default`, `reload`, `no-cache`).Defaults to `no-cache`

params.name: options.mode
params.description: Defines the mode of the request (e.g., `cors`, `no-cors`, `same-origin`, `navigate`.). Defaults to `cors`

params.name: options.credentials
params.description: Contains the credentials of the request (e.g., `omit`, `same-origin`, `include`). Defaults to `include`

methods.name: request
methods.description:
Executes an AJAX request using Fetch polyfill and returns a raw Response instance.

It could throw a RequestError in case the server responds with a non-ok status code or if the response data could not be parsed into a JSON object.

Usage:

try {
   const response = await this.ajax.json('/api/users');
   const users = await response.json();
} catch (e) {
   console.error('Failed to fetch users from the API', e);
}

params.name: url
params.description: Request path or an absolute URL

params.name: options
params.description: Request options

params.name: options.progress
params.description: Should the service increment or decrement progress counter, defaults to `true`

params.name: options.contentType
params.description: Defines a content type header for the request, defaults to `application/json`

params.name: options.cache
params.description: Contains the cache mode of the request (e.g., `default`, `reload`, `no-cache`).Defaults to `no-cache`

params.name: options.mode
params.description: Defines the mode of the request (e.g., `cors`, `no-cors`, `same-origin`, `navigate`.). Defaults to `cors`

params.name: options.credentials
params.description: Contains the credentials of the request (e.g., `omit`, `same-origin`, `include`). Defaults to `include`

methods.name: buildURL
methods.description: Creates a URL instance out of a given url or path. It also tries to encode the supplied query parameters in the final URL.

params.name: url
params.description: URL to be built, it can be an absolute URL or a relative path

params.name: query
params.description: Query parameters to be encoded in the final URL

accessors.name: interceptors
accessors.description:
List of available Request Interceptors that are defined in the application.

Request Interceptors should be placed inside the interceptors folder in order to be registered by Ember Container Registry.

attributes.name: CookiesService
attributes.description: Cookie service that provides access to cookies in the browser.

methods.name: read
methods.description: Reads the cookie with the given name, returns its value as a String

tags.name: returns
tags.value: {String} cookie value or `null` if it does not exist

returns.description: cookie value or `null` if it does not exist

methods.name: sync
methods.description: Synchronizes the state of the service with the current cookies in the browser.

attributes.name: ErrorResolverService
attributes.description:
Ember Service used to transform caught runtime errors into meaningfull messages that can be shown to the user.

This service is usually used in Ember Routes to handle error actions. Best place for it would be in your Application Route where it would catch all error actions and show an error notifications using the ember-notify addon.

export default class ApplicationRoute extends Route {
  @service('error-resolver') errorResolver;

  @action error(error, transition = null) {
    // check if this error occurred during the transition, if thas the case we should
    // render an error page with the transformed error messages, otherwise show a notification alert
    if (transition && transition.isTransition) {
      return this.intermediateTransitionTo('error', this.errorResolver.resolve(error));
   }

    // show the error notification of the resolved error
    return this.errorResolver.notify(error);
  }
}

methods.name: resolve
methods.description: Tries to resolve an error object into a ResolvedError that contains the translated messages and status code related to it.

methods.name: notify
methods.description: Resolves an error using the #resolve method and for each resolved error it would try to show the the error notification using the ember-notify service.

params.name: error
params.description: Error that needs to be resolved and shown as a notification

params.name: options
params.description: Options object for the `ember-notify` service

attributes.name: LocaleService
attributes.description:
Service for managing and selecting locales for your application.

Here is an example Language switcher component using the locale service:

export default class LanguageSwitcherComponent extends Component {
  @service locale;

  // update the active locale
  @action update(locale) {
    this.locale.active = locale;
  }
}

And it's corresponding template:

<div class="list-group">
  {{#each this.locale.available as |locale|}}
    <a href="#" class="list-group-item list-group-item-action" {{on "click" (fn this.update locale)}}>
     {{t (concat "locales." locale.iso)}}
    </a>
  {{/each}}
</div>

You would notice that when the locale is selected the translation for the locale would change to the appropriate language as this service is setting the primary locale in the ember-intl addon under the hood.

The same applies to moment, where all the date labels and formats would be updated if you are using the ember-moment helpers.

fields.name: storage
fields.description: Session storage that is used to extract the current session locale value

fields.name: session
fields.description: Session service instance that is used to extract the configured locale from the currently logged in user account.

fields.name: intl
fields.description: Ember' intl service instance that is used to extract available locales that can be used for selection and to update the currently selected locale.

fields.name: moment
fields.description: Ember's moment service instance that is used to format dates.

fields.name: available
fields.description:
An array of available locales that are avaiable for selection.

This value is derived from Ember Intl addon. Please check the ember-intl addon to see how to configure available locales.

fields.name: _active
fields.description: Currently active locale instance.

methods.name: normalize
methods.description: Normalizes the locale the string into an Object containg the language and country code.

params.name: locale
params.description: Locale string

attributes.name: ProgressService
attributes.description: Service used to manage NProgress that also keeps track how many asynchronous operations were done in order to show or hide the progress bar.

fields.name: counter
fields.description:
Current progress counter.

It is used to check if there are still any pending requests in order to show or hide the NProgress indicator.

methods.name: start
methods.description: Start the NProgress by showing loading bar and indicator if it's not already shown.

methods.name: done
methods.description: Stop the NProgress and hide the loading bar and indicator if all pending operations are finished.

fields.name: ajax
fields.description: AJAX service instance used to obtain the current session information from the configured API server.

fields.name: storage
fields.description: Local Storage Object that stores session state.

fields.name: session
fields.description: Current session information obtained from the API Server. It could be null if the API server returns a non-ok status code or session is not yet retrieved.

fields.name: isAuthenticated
fields.description: Property that checks if the session is authenticated by checking if the user object is present in the session.

fields.name: company
fields.description: Current session company associated with the user account extracted from the session state.

fields.name: user
fields.description: Current session principal/user extracted from the session state.

fields.name: config
fields.description: Current configuration extracted from the session state.

fields.name: tenant
fields.description: Current Tenant extracted from the session state.

fields.name: theme
fields.description: Current stylesheet theme extracted from the session state.

fields.name: permissions
fields.description: List of permissions that are associated with currently logged in user.

methods.name: hasPermission
methods.description:
Checks if this user session has provided permissions. You can defined permissions like so:

  • hasPermission(['read', 'write']) -> means that the user needs to have both of them set
  • hasPermission(['read', ['write', 'update']]) -> means that the user needs to have read and either write or update set

returns.description: `true` if the current user has permssions

methods.name: restore
methods.description:
Tries to restore the already authenticated session if it's present. Once the Authentication API confirms that the session if valid we can set it up in the service.

When a user session is returned a session:restored event would be triggered that would instruct the application to redirect the user to intended Transition or an index by default.

methods.name: invalidate
methods.description: Tries to invalidated the current session if it's present and triggers a session:invalidated event that would instruct the application to reload the page and hopefully redirect to the login page.

attributes.name: ThemeManagerService
attributes.description:
Service that is managing different Unite Themes that are defined for Tennats.

Each Tenant could have a dedicated CSS Theme depending on the configuration. This Tenant configuration is extracted by the SessionService each time the Application loads.

fields.name: setup
fields.description: Setup a Theme for the currently active Client configuration. CSS Asset is loaded using the head-data service that renders the stylesheet tag.

attributes.name: Sort
attributes.description: Class containing the Table sort information of a column that is derived from the query parameter value.

variables.name: SORT_DIRECTIONS
variables.description: Object containing the available sort directions for a table column

attributes.name: UnauthenticatedError
attributes.description: Thrown by the Session Service when this User Account is not logged in yet.

accessors.name: status
accessors.description: Returns the HTTP status code of the error. It is always 401

attributes.name: URLFormatter
attributes.description: *

fields.name: parse
fields.description: Attempts to parse the configuration object in order to construct the base URL string that would be used for the final formatted URL.

fields.name: encode
fields.description: Encodes the JSON object into a URLSearchParams instance.

methods.name: format
methods.description: Formats the given URL argument to an absolute URL string.

params.name: url
params.description: URL to be formatted

params.name: params
params.description: URL query parameters to be encoded
